parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pity, mercy, compassion. Of uncertain affinity; compassion.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A bath (of water, not the vessel), water for washing, washing. From louo; a bath, i.e., baptism.
A new birth, regeneration, renewal. From palin and genesis; rebirth, i.e. spiritual renovation; specially, Messianic restoration.
Renewing; a renewal or change of heart and life. From anakainoo; renovation.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
